newsitem.title: JAPAN: Isuzu hopes to build engine plant in Poland.
newsitem.headline: Isuzu hopes to build engine plant in Poland.

text.p: Isuzu Motors Ltd said on Thursday it plans to apply by the end of February to build a diesel engine plant in Poland in 1999.
It said the total investment would amount to 380 million marks, equivalent to 26 billion yen.
It hoped to start production by the summer of 1999.
It said a new company would be set up in March to run the plant, tentatively named Isuzu Poland. The size of its capital had yet to be decided. It will be owned 100 percent by Isuzu.

The engine to be produced at the plant would meet tighter European Union emission regulations expected to be implemented in 2000. The plant was expected to produce 200,000 engines in 1999, and 300,000 in 2000.
Engines from the plant would be supplied to General Motors Corp group companies in Europe, including Adam Opel in Germany and Vauxhall Motors in Britain, as well as other European automakers.
The plant would create 600 jobs, it said.
